title: Amulet of ESP
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Amulet_of_ESP/zh-CN "Amulet of ESP/zh-CN")

| " [![Circular amulet.png](/images/8/8b/Circular_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Circular_amulet.png) |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                         | amulet of ESP                                                 |
| Appearance                                                                                   | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                                                   | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                                                       | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |

An **amulet of ESP** is a type of [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") amulet of ESP.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 NetHack: The Next Generation](#NetHack:_The_Next_Generation)
  - [5.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Generation

The amulet of ESP is the most common amulet on average, making up 17.5% of all randomly-generated amulets.

## Description

While worn, an amulet of ESP grants extrinsic [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"), allowing you to see all non-[mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") monsters within a radius of 8 squares around you; while [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), you can also see all non-mindless monsters on the level. [Eating the amulet](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") has a 1⁄5 chance of giving you intrinsic telepathy.

## Strategy

As one of two non-artifact sources of extrinsic telepathy, the amulet of ESP is one of the better amulets early on, and does not impact spellcasting like the [helm of telepathy](/wiki/Helm_of_telepathy "Helm of telepathy"), making it more ideal for casting-focused players. In the later game, it is often replaced by the [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") or [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving"); several roles have [quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") that provide extrinsic telepathy and can render the amulet redundant.

### Identification

The amulet of ESP is one of the more straightforward amulets to informally identify, as you can use [;](/wiki/Semicolon "Semicolon") to [far look](/wiki/Far_look "Far look") and select a monster that you shouldn't be able to see, e.g. a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") behind a closed door, with [.](/wiki/Dot "Dot") - the output will tell you whether you are seeing it because of telepathy, and if you have no other source, it must be coming from the amulet.

## History

The amulet of ESP is introduced with most of the other amulets in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### NetHack: The Next Generation

In [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"), the home floor of the [Geek quest](/wiki/Geek_quest "Geek quest") has an amulet of ESP along with a blindfold for the purpose of viewing the text artwork created using monsters that are locked in place.

### SLASH'EM

Among the [defunct features](/wiki/Defunct_features_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Defunct features (SLASH'EM)") in the data of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") is [The Medallion of Shifters](/wiki/The_Medallion_of_Shifters "The Medallion of Shifters"), an artifact amulet of ESP that acted as the quest artifact for [Doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)") before starting races and roles were made distinct in subsequent versions.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), one of the three possible prize amulets that can be claimed after clearing [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban_\(UnNetHack\) "Sokoban (UnNetHack)") is an amulet of ESP.

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the Geek role and its quest branch from NetHack: The Next Generation, and retains the defunct Medallion of Shifters along with much of the defunct features from SLASH'EM.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Amulet of ESP

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
"
Name amulet of ESP
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 20

An amulet of ESP is a type of amulet that appears in NetHack.

The Eye of the Aethiopica is an artifact amulet of ESP.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 NetHack: The Next Generation
    • 5.2 SLASH'EM
    • 5.3 UnNetHack
    • 5.4 SlashTHEM

Generation

The amulet of ESP is the most common amulet on average, making up 17.5% of all randomly-generated amulets.

Description

While worn, an amulet of ESP grants extrinsic telepathy, allowing you to see all non-mindless monsters within a radius of 8 squares around you; while blind, you can also see all non-mindless monsters on the level. Eating the amulet has a 1⁄5 chance of giving you intrinsic telepathy.

Strategy

As one of two non-artifact sources of extrinsic telepathy, the amulet of ESP is one of the better amulets early on, and does not impact spellcasting like the helm of telepathy, making it more ideal for casting-focused players. In the later game, it is often replaced by the amulet of reflection or amulet of life saving; several roles have quest artifacts that provide extrinsic telepathy and can render the amulet redundant.

Identification

The amulet of ESP is one of the more straightforward amulets to informally identify, as you can use ; to far look and select a monster that you shouldn't be able to see, e.g. a pet behind a closed door, with . - the output will tell you whether you are seeing it because of telepathy, and if you have no other source, it must be coming from the amulet.

History

The amulet of ESP is introduced with most of the other amulets in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

NetHack: The Next Generation

In NetHack: The Next Generation, the home floor of the Geek quest has an amulet of ESP along with a blindfold for the purpose of viewing the text artwork created using monsters that are locked in place.

SLASH'EM

Among the defunct features in the data of SLASH'EM is The Medallion of Shifters, an artifact amulet of ESP that acted as the quest artifact for Doppelgangers before starting races and roles were made distinct in subsequent versions.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, one of the three possible prize amulets that can be claimed after clearing Sokoban is an amulet of ESP.

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM adds the Geek role and its quest branch from NetHack: The Next Generation, and retains the defunct Medallion of Shifters along with much of the defunct features from SLASH'EM.

{{amulet|name=amulet of ESP}}

An '''amulet of ESP''' is a type of [[amulet]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

[[The Eye of the Aethiopica]] is an [[artifact]] amulet of ESP.

==Generation==
The amulet of ESP is the most common amulet on average, making up 17.5% of all randomly-generated amulets.

==Description==
While worn, an amulet of ESP grants extrinsic [[telepathy]], allowing you to see all non-[[mindless]] monsters within a radius of 8 squares around you; while [[blind]], you can also see all non-mindless monsters on the level. [[Eating jewelry|Eating the amulet]] has a {{frac|5}} chance of giving you intrinsic telepathy.

==Strategy==
As one of two non-artifact sources of extrinsic telepathy, the amulet of ESP is one of the better amulets early on, and does not impact spellcasting like the [[helm of telepathy]], making it more ideal for casting-focused players. In the later game, it is often replaced by the [[amulet of reflection]] or [[amulet of life saving]]; several roles have [[quest artifact]]s that provide extrinsic telepathy and can render the amulet redundant.

===Identification===
The amulet of ESP is one of the more straightforward amulets to informally identify, as you can use {{kbd|;}} to [[far look]] and select a monster that you shouldn't be able to see, e.g. a [[pet]] behind a closed door, with {{kbd|.}} - the output will tell you whether you are seeing it because of telepathy, and if you have no other source, it must be coming from the amulet.

==History==
The amulet of ESP is introduced with most of the other amulets in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===NetHack: The Next Generation===
In [[NetHack: The Next Generation]], the home floor of the [[Geek quest]] has an amulet of ESP along with a blindfold for the purpose of viewing the text artwork created using monsters that are locked in place.

===SLASH'EM===
Among the [[Defunct features (SLASH'EM)|defunct features]] in the data of [[SLASH'EM]] is [[The Medallion of Shifters]], an artifact amulet of ESP that acted as the quest artifact for [[Doppelganger (starting race)|Doppelgangers]] before starting races and roles were made distinct in subsequent versions.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], one of the three possible prize amulets that can be claimed after clearing [[Sokoban (UnNetHack)|Sokoban]] is an amulet of ESP.

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] adds the Geek role and its quest branch from NetHack: The Next Generation, and retains the defunct Medallion of Shifters along with much of the defunct features from SLASH'EM.
